content: http://www.ksl.com/ Last night, in the small central Utah town of Centerfield/Gunnison, where a person might just as well ride a horse down main street as drive his pickup, a robber armed with a .22 rifle came into the convenience store to hold up the place. When the robber started forcing the clerks to tie each other up, they decided this was going to be a hostage situation or worse - - So they jumped the guy - took his gun - and SHOT him to death!!! YEH!! The guy should have heeded an age-old saying: Don't bring a gun to Gunnison, son!!! This message has been edited. Last edited by: greywolfghost, Mon 09 March 2009 06:13 PM Wandering and Wondering
reply: http://www.ksl.com/ Last night, in the small central Utah town of Centerfield/Gunnison, where a person might just as well ride a horse down main street as drive his pickup, a robber armed with a .22 rifle came into the convenience store to hold up the place. title: Notice: Don't try to rob convenience story in a cowtown

content: Good for them! Note: Cowtown (capitalized) isn't anywhere in Utah. It's Ft. Worth, TX.

title: Notice: Don't try to rob convenience story in a cowtown

content: Gunnison is a wide spot in the road in a sagebrush area about 150 miles south of Salt Lake City. Thing that weird about somebody robbing a place there is that are only 3 roads out of town, and you have to drive 20 miles to hit another town on any one of them....with Highway Patrol stations in all of them - what a moron's moron - - And the clerks that wrestled the gun away and shot him in the head - were ladies!! Wandering and Wondering

content: Good for them! That man will never rob anyone else again. Now watch the local law enforcement charge them for murder. Keep us posted.

title: Notice: Don't try to rob convenience story in a cowtown

content: Not in that town. It isn't named Gunnison by chance. He was a famous explorer that come through there, and the Ole West Pioneer and Cowboy Spirit runs pretty deep there still. The Police were on the TV praising them for standing their ground. There has been such a plague of such robberies up around Salt Lake and Ogden recently that people are just fed up. Don't hear of such things in Provo so far - maybe because a number of store owners have taken to wearing visible sidearms - which is legal there - Wandering and Wondering
